==Events==
*[[1258]] &ndash; [[Baghdad]] [[Siege of Baghdad (1258)|falls]] to the [[Mongol Empire|Mongols]], and the [[Abbasid Caliphate]] is destroyed.
*[[1306]] &ndash; In front of the high altar of Greyfriars Church in [[Dumfries]], [[Robert the Bruce]] murders [[Red Comyn|John Comyn]] sparking revolution in the [[Scottish Wars of Independence]]
*[[1355]] &ndash; The [[St Scholastica riot|St. Scholastica's Day riot]] breaks out in [[Oxford]], [[England]], leaving 63 scholars and perhaps 30 locals dead in two days.
*[[1567]] &ndash; [[Henry Stuart, Lord Darnley|Lord Darnley]], second husband of [[Mary, Queen of Scots]], is found strangled following an explosion at the [[Kirk o' Field|Kirk o' Field house]] in [[Edinburgh]], [[Scotland]], a suspected assassination.
*[[1763]] &ndash; [[French and Indian War]]: The [[1763 Treaty of Paris]] ends the war and [[France]] cedes [[Quebec]] to [[Great Britain]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Louis Alexandre Berthier]] invades [[Rome]], proclaims a [[Roman Republic (18th century)|Roman Republic]] on [[February 15]] and then on [[February 20]] takes [[Pope Pius VI]] prisoner.
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: The [[Battle of Champaubert]] ends in French victory over the [[Russian Empire|Russians]] and the [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussians]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; Queen [[Victoria of the United Kingdom]] marries [[Prince Albert of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[First Anglo-Sikh War]]: [[Battle of Sobraon]] &ndash; British defeat Sikhs in final battle of the war
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[Jefferson Davis]] is notified by telegraph that he has been chosen as provisional President of the [[Confederate States of America]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: A Union naval flotilla destroys the bulk of the Confederate [[Mosquito Fleet]] in the [[Battle of Elizabeth City]] on the [[Pasquotank River]] in [[North Carolina]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; The [[YWCA]] is founded in [[New York City]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; {{HMS|Dreadnought|1906|6}}, the first of a revolutionary [[Dreadnought|new breed of battleships]] is christened and launched by [[King Edward VII]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Jozef Haller de Hallenburg]] performs [[Poland's Wedding to the Sea|symbolic wedding of Poland to the sea]], celebrating restitution of [[Poland|Polish]] access to open sea.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Texas Tech University]] is founded as Texas Technological College in [[Lubbock, Texas]]
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Yên Bái mutiny]] in [[French Indochina]]
*[[1933]] &ndash; In round 13 of a [[boxing]] match at [[New York City]]'s [[Madison Square Garden (1925)|Madison Square Garden]], [[Primo Carnera]] knocks out [[Ernie Schaaf]]. Schaaf dies four days later.
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Second Italo-Abyssinian War]]: [[Kingdom of Italy (1861–1946)|Italian]] troops launched the [[Battle of Amba Aradam]] against [[Ethiopian Empire|Ethiopian]] defenders.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: The [[Francoist Spain|Nationalists]] conclude their [[Catalonia Offensive|conquest of Catalonia]] and seal the border with France.
*[[1940]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] begins mass deportations of Polish citizens from [[Territories of Poland annexed by the Soviet Union|occupied eastern Poland]] to Siberia.
*[[1942]] &ndash; The first [[Music recording sales certification|gold record]] is presented to [[Glenn Miller]] for "[[Chattanooga Choo Choo]]".
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Attempting to completely lift the [[Siege of Leningrad]], the [[Red Army|Soviet Red Army]] engages [[Nazi Germany|German]] troops and [[Francoist Spain|Spanish]] volunteers in the [[Battle of Krasny Bor]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Italy]] cedes most of [[Venezia Giulia]] to [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Dwight Eisenhower]] warns against [[United States]] intervention in [[Vietnam]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; Captured [[United States|American]] [[Lockheed U-2|U2 spy-plane]] pilot [[Gary Powers]] is exchanged for captured [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] spy [[Rudolf Abel]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Roy Lichtenstein]]'s first solo exhibition opened, and it included ''[[Look Mickey]]'', which featured his first employment of [[Ben-Day dots]], [[speech balloon]]s and comic imagery sourcing, all of which he is now known for.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Melbourne-Voyager collision]]: The aircraft carrier {{HMAS|Melbourne|R21|6}} collides with and sinks the destroyer  {{HMAS|Voyager|D04|6}} off the south coast of [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]], killing 82.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution|25th Amendment to the United States Constitution]] is ratified.
*[[1981]] &ndash; A [[Las Vegas Hilton#Fire|fire at the Las Vegas Hilton]] [[hotel]]-[[casino]] kills eight and injures 198.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Ron Brown (U.S. politician)|Ron Brown]] is elected chairman of the [[Democratic National Committee]] becoming the first [[African American]] to lead a major [[United States|American]] [[political party]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[IBM]] supercomputer [[IBM Deep Blue|Deep Blue]] defeats [[Garry Kasparov]] in chess for the first time.
*[[1998]] &ndash; Voters in [[Maine]] repeal a [[LGBT rights in the United States|gay rights]] law passed in [[1997]] becoming the first [[U.S. state]] to abandon such a law.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[France]] and [[Belgium]] break the [[NATO]] procedure of silent approval concerning the timing of protective measures for [[Turkey]] in case of a possible war with [[Iraq]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[communication satellite]]s [[Iridium 33]] and [[Kosmos-2251]] [[2009 satellite collision|collide in orbit]], destroying both.
*[[2013]] &ndash; Thirty-six people are killed and 39 others are injured in a [[2013 Kumbh Mela stampede|stampede]] in [[Allahabad]], India, during the [[Kumbh Mela]] festival.
